div1.p: I shall give you all the information I can in regard to Corpl. Altymier. He was missing at the Battle of "Hatcher's Run" on the 6th day of February 1865. I have never been able to say whther he was taken Prisoner or Killed. He was with the company on going into the fight and when we was driven back late in the evening. It is very probable that he was taken prisoner. I had 3 (three) missing in my co. Never heard from any of them. However, I don't think he was killed. We advanced over the same ground next day and would very probable have seen him. I am sorry for him. He was a noble soldier, miss him very much in the company. We have had a very exciting time a few days back there was great excitement when Lee surrendered his Army of Northern Virginia. I think the war is about at an end now. We have just recd. an official Dispatch of the Surrender of Johnson's Army. Great cheering going on.
